channel.title: ShiverIDE
channel.description:
Simple IDE I cooked up last night and today.
Doesn't have syntax highlighting, yet.
[img]http://img23.imageshack.us/img23/4138/shiveride.png[/img] [img]http://img10.imageshack.us/img10/862/shiveride2.png[/img]
http://uppit.com/v/XK4ZFWIH

item.title: ShiverIDE
item.dc:creator: @PeeHPee PeeHPee
item.description:
@PeeHPee wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Rip the syntax highlighting from another open source project, I believe I used code from jEdit in SIDE.

I believe GeSHI was ported to java, ‘JeSHI’ I’m sure it was called.

edit: its called JaSHI, http://sourceforge.net/projects/jashi/

Read full topic

item.title: ShiverIDE
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Shiver, post:10, topic:275849”]Ah, I believe it is due to Linux.

public static final String CONFIG_DIR = "\\config\\";

should be

public static final String CONFIG_DIR = "/config/";

edit:
Yeah, the create project button isn’t implemented yet.[/quote]

That is correct, but why did you make it proprietary to a specific OS in the first place? You could have used ./config/ at least.

Read full topic

item.title: ShiverIDE
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

I thought about making an IDE a while ago and knew it would be easy, but making one that people use would be impossible without all the additional tools, projects settings, detailed debugging/suggestions, , and all the other features other IDEs I can’t name.

Read full topic

item.title: ShiverIDE
item.dc:creator: @Shiver Shiver
item.description:
@Shiver wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:11, topic:275849”]Fixed it using File.separator.
Now get your IDE to build within your IDE, so you can use it to develop your IDE.
I think you’ll need to add the ability to reference libraries (or at least a way to specify the compiler arguments).[/quote]

You can compile from within the IDE, just go to Project -> Compile.
Also, thanks for the ideas.

Read full topic

item.title: ShiverIDE
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Fixed it using File.separator.
Now get your IDE to build within your IDE, so you can use it to develop your IDE.
I think you’ll need to add the ability to reference libraries (or at least a way to specify the compiler arguments).

Read full topic

item.title: ShiverIDE
item.dc:creator: @Shiver Shiver
item.description:
@Shiver wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:9, topic:275849”][quote author=Shiver link=topic=364376.msg2766040#msg2766040 date=1240796866]

jonny@spark:~/Desktop/ShiverIDE$ java -jar ShiverIDE.jar 
Exception in thread "main" net.shiver.ide.project.exception.CorruptedProjectException: Could not find config directory.
	at net.shiver.ide.project.ProjectManager.loadProject(ProjectManager.java:36)
	at net.shiver.ide.Main.main(Main.java:26)

Appears to be a project without the “config” folder?
[/quote]
I’m not loading any projects…it crashes as soon as I run the jar.

It appears your directory structure is “ShiverIDE/projects/test_project/config/”, but the program is trying to load this: “ShiverIDE/projects/config/”[/quote]

Ah, I believe it is due to Linux.

public static final String CONFIG_DIR = "\\config\\";

should be

public static final String CONFIG_DIR = "/config/";

edit:
Yeah, the create project button isn’t implemented yet.

Read full topic

item.title: ShiverIDE
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Shiver, post:8, topic:275849”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=364376.msg2766039#msg2766039 date=1240796790]

jonny@spark:~/Desktop/ShiverIDE$ java -jar ShiverIDE.jar 
Exception in thread "main" net.shiver.ide.project.exception.CorruptedProjectException: Could not find config directory.
	at net.shiver.ide.project.ProjectManager.loadProject(ProjectManager.java:36)
	at net.shiver.ide.Main.main(Main.java:26)

[/quote]

Appears to be a project without the “config” folder?[/quote]
I’m not loading any projects…it crashes as soon as I run the jar.
Removing test_project from the projects dir fixes the problem.
The New Project button doesn’t seem to do anything however.

Read full topic
